fields.summary: Server to Cloud import fail due to solution_ext table

fields.description:
If someone changes the parent of an Issue in Portfolio and commits this change, an IssueEvent should be fired.

This is currently not the case and the change is also not visible in the Issue history.
fields.summary: Fire IssueEvent on Parent Link change from within a Portfolio Plan

fields.description:
Currently JIRA Portfolio always labels future sprints as "Sprint 2, Sprint 3, Sprint 4" etc without taking into account the actual Sprint number a JIRA Agile board.

For example, if I create a board in JIRA Agile, the default name is Some Name 1. When I complete and start a new board we get Some Name 2.

Hence when we look at Some Name 2 in JIRA Portfolio we see something like this in Releases
Some Name 2 , Sprint 2, Sprint 3, Sprint 4

This request is for the ability to make future sprint placeholder numbers configurable to avoid confusion
fields.summary: Allow future sprint numbers to be configurable in Releases view

fields.description:
h5. Problem
When modifying the label field and then choosing to clear the value, the originally selected label will still apply to the issue.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Load a Portfolio plan in scope view
# Show the labels columns
# Place a label on one of the issues
** Do not commit
# Remove the label by pressing "clear all values" or unchecking the selected label
# Commit the changes
# Refresh the plan

h5. Expected Behaviour
No label is added to the issue.

h5. Actual Behaviour
The label that was selected has been added to the ticket.
fields.summary: Removing Label does not Persist

fields.description:
From the Issue details window, enable the ability to create and delete children of the parent. 

For the screenshot:
 # Shortcut button to create child.
 # Shortcut button to delete child.

This same shortcut exists for the "Issue Links" feature.
fields.summary: Enable shortcuts to create/delete children from the Parent Issue

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be group specific users together so that I can schedule absences by group. 

 

The problem I'm trying to solve is that I have multiple teams in a plan from across the world that all have different holidays.  

 

My current work around is to schedule each user's holidays one by one.
fields.summary: Shared Teams & People | Grouping and scheduling absences

fields.description: This is causing confusion for our users, as the Portfolio fields (team, parent link) display an error in basic search saying that they are not applicable for the current project/issue type - which is misleading.
fields.summary: Portfolio fields should work in basic search, not just Advanced JQL

fields.description:
Currently, when users try to filter issues in the "Review and commit changes" section using a project key, it won't return any results.

Please add this functionality so users that have Plans with multiple projects can filter only issues from specific projects in an easier way
fields.summary: Allow filtering for Project key in the "Review and commit changes" section

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

There needs to be a way to re-prioritize issues other than drag and drop. If there are 100 issues in the list this method is nearly impossible and very time-consuming.
h3. Suggested Solution

In portfolio regardless of issue type you looking at, Epic, Story, or custom defined type. They show up in a backlog, ordered by RANK. When you have 100 issues to reorder dragging them around is painful and slow. The backlogs in JIRA have a right click function that allows you to move something to the top or bottom of the backlog without dragging. This would be a great start if this functionality was brought into Portfolio. Additionally the rank numbers on the right side, it would be awesome if I could just type over let say issue 99 and automatically move it to 5 and the whole list would reorder moving the current 5 to 6 and so on to make room for 99 to move to 5. this would be ideal.
h3. Workaround

No (quick) workaround found.
fields.summary: Selecting multi issues and reordering

fields.description: Sometimes during the scheduling of Portfolio level items a given Portfolio item is scheduled to be worked on in a Sprint (say, Sprint 1) and then there is a gap where the work on this item is not scheduled for a few next Sprints and eventually it is scheduled in a more remote Sprint (say, Sprint 9) and finished there. We were trying to workaround this using the Earliest Start constraints, but we believe this gap in execution is violating Limit WIP principles and should be avoided by scheduling algorithm by design.
fields.summary: Portfolio level items for non contiguous sprints

fields.description:
Another limitation we are seeing is related to the presentation of nested items and visualization of work on time scale. This is described below:
Suppose we have a Portfolio Item (SAFe Epic) with 3 Capabilities underneath: C1, C2 and C3. Each of the Capabilities has in turn 3 Features:
F-A, F-B and F-C are under C1,
F-D, F-E and F-F are under C2,
F-G, F-H and F-I are under C3.

The Features get story point estimate either from Stories linked to them or the estimate is put directly into Features when there are no Stories defined yet. Then, the estimates in Capabilities and Portfolio are simply roll up of Feature estimates. Features are then scheduled either based on Stories (if available) or based on their estimate and teams' capacity / skill set. This all works as expected.

What we are looking for as a useful addition is:
 * for Capabilities and Portfolio to have the duration bar on the Schedule displayed automatically based on the duration of the underlying Features.
 * for Portfolio and Capability on the Schedule to have an "expand" clickable link (like a "+") that would expand the item and would show the underlying items and their duration. We would need that on two levels: expand Portfolio to see Capabilities and then expand Capability / Capabilities to see the Features.
 * for the entire Schedule to be able to filter by Portfolio and Capability, so that if we choose a Portfolio item we can see only this Portfolio item on the schedule, but we can still expand it as described in the bullet above. The same for Capability.
fields.summary: Presentation of nested items and visualization of work on a timescale

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

The scope view can only be filtered by the fields detailed [on this part of the JPO documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/using-the-scope-view-802170536.html] which makes it very limited.

\\
h2. Suggested Solution

Add more flexibility to the scope filter functionality by adding a JQL interface or the ability to use saved JIRA filters.
fields.summary: Add a JQL interface to the scope filter functionality

fields.description:
The Portfolio groups act like global permissions. Members added to a Portfolio group have global portfolio rights based on the group controls. This does not work for permission controls through Roles and schemes. 

*Suggest extending the Role permission controls to include Portfolio permission controls.* 

 

The PROJECT administrator is better informed to add individual users to the roles that correspond to their project roles, per project. Note: a Product Owner (PO) would be given more rights to their primary projects but limited rights to secondary projects. We don't want all POs to be able to rearrange all project backlogs.

Like permissions on Issues, the project admin can add the project PO to the project Role.PO.

Unlike Issues, what the project SHOULD be able to do:

All POs that depend on the primary projects would be added to Role.PO. 
All members of Role.PO are also granted Portfolio_Users access.

All POs that observe on secondary projects would be added to Role.observer. 
All members of Role.observe are also granted Portfolio_Viewers access. 

The Permissions scheme should have the portfolio permission controls added such that Role.PO can be added to Portfolio_Users control and Role.observer can be added to Portfolio_Viewers control. 

The current Portfolio groups would be added to Global permissions for those that need full portfolio rights across all projects. 

Why the current portfolio permission model is cumbersome:

We have ~9,000 users in the system through Active Directory. As we create new projects they will need to be given the correct access to their primary projects and observer access to all other projects. For portfolio access the project admins will have to inform our small group of jira-admin\Jira-sysad when a user is added to a specific role so they can be added to the corresponding portfolio group. All users must be warned that they have global portfolio access and specific project access. They might not find out the level of permissions on projects until they try to commit plan changes. 

Please integrate portfolio permissions into JIRA software and core permissions so that the scheme creation and permission controls are implemented consistently. This is another issue that makes the JIRA products (Portfolio) look and feel separate an not integrated.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator I can create a project and grant a user project administration rights, such that the project administrator can add individuals to their corresponding role for the project and portfolio.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Incorrect error when trying to edit Parent Link in JIRA and the user is not a Portfolio User

h3. Environment

Reproduced on JIRA 7.5.0 and Portfolio 2.6.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a *Heirarchy* Level about Epics
# Add *Parent Link* field to an Epics edit screen.
# Access JIRA as a user that doesn't belong to a group added under *Portfolio User* permission. 
# Open an Epic in JIRA 
# Edit the Epic and try to set the "Parent Link" 

h3. Expected Results

Error message saying the user cannot perform this action as the user doesn't have permission. 

h3. Actual Results

Error message says:
{noformat}
You are not authorized to perform this operation.  
Please log in.
{noformat}
 !error.png|thumbnail! 
Although the user is not authorized to perform this operation, the user is already logged in. Therefore the error message should not ask the user to login.
fields.summary: Incorrect error when trying to edit Parent Link in JIRA and the user is not a Portfolio User

fields.description: On the Sprint report, it would be useful ( for me at least) to see the free capacity by Stage/Skill ; so I can figure out what else can be added to the Sprint
fields.summary: Report on Planned and Free Capacity by Stage/Skill

fields.description:

Issue ihas "Team" and "Sprint" assigned properly.

Then issue has been closed.

!https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ui=2&ik=b2aaf9b487&view=fimg&th=15e9e8a35d2df89b&attid=0.1&disp=emb&realattid=ii_15e9e8a35d2df89b&attbid=ANGjdJ-39Si7e0BywYHc2kzMcLfLfXc-982tk9b4Rf4hPAKemmQr5I5Au6S2Uc3ivsl066ha952VX26eIppMtq-2HdXSJCytGIDrNiExAxT0sMwJ_VNZ3PYG5POSlXs&sz=s0-l75&ats=1505898411827&rm=15e9e8a35d2df89b&zw|width=544,height=84!

fields.description: It would be very useful to have the ability to filter the scope list in portfolio by sprint
fields.summary: Ability to filter by sprint

fields.description:
It would be very useful to have the ability to manually add items in and out of sprints.

This would allow for focus on specific items and how adding these to a sprint could effect capacity for that sprint.

At the moment the calculate function always kicks in to fill the sprint.
fields.summary: Disable calculate function

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

There is no rest API call to get an issue with its respective JIRA Portfolio team name.

\\
h2. Suggested Solution

Provide a rest API call to get the JPO's team name.

\\
h2. Workaround 

If you currently run:

https://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issue/issue-key

Part of the response will have:

{noformat}
"customfield_15238":"882"
{noformat}

\\
To correlate the issue with its JPO custom field, you have to:

check that custom field 15238 is the Teams (com.atlassian.teams:rm-teams-custom-field-team) custom field in the database by running the below query

{noformat}
SELECT * FROM customfield WHERE id = 15238;
{noformat}

\\
to match the id from the rest API call to the team's field name, you have to query the AO_82B313_TEAM table as shown below:

{noformat}
SELECT id, title FROM AO_82B313_TEAM where id = {take the id from the rest api call, in the below example "882"}
{noformat}

\\
To summarize, to correlate an issue with its respective JPO team currently you have to:

# run the rest API call
# parse its output 
# take the id and then run the above select statement in order get the team's name 

\\
fields.summary: I would like to have a rest API call that returns the issues' details with their respective Portfolio Teams name.

fields.description: In Portfolio it is not currently possible to see who is the creator of a plan which could be used for administration purposes among other things.
fields.summary: Track and surface the creator of a Portfolio Plan

fields.description:
Initial status:
 * I have the live plan with example of 3 issues bellow:

!image-2017-09-11-10-05-06-129.png!

Team is "Calculated" in JIRA Portfolio, Sprint is set in JIRA Agile, no Team value is set in JIRa issue.

!image-2017-09-11-10-06-51-138.png!

Once I close this issue in JIRA Agile:

!image-2017-09-11-10-07-50-405.png!

 

In JIRa Portfolio the appropriate row got TEAM and SPRINT values cleared up once you re-"Calculate" a plan.

!image-2017-09-11-10-10-49-013.png!

 

More notes:
 * If you push only F5 both fields are not cleaned up.
 * If TEAM is set at issue level both fields are not cleaned up

Expected behavior:
 * If Sprint relays on TEAM, the "Calculated" TEAM value should show up as a change to commit form JIRa Portfolio to JIRA Agile.
 * If not possible (e.g not Shared Team created) value should be kept in Scope view as for previous statuses of JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Sprint is cleared up in scope view when Issue is closed without TEAM field filled in.

fields.description:
There are a working people simultaneously in with the portfolio planning. 
 In case of large changes, eg. using of calculate function, it is difficult to revert the own changes due to the fact, that we cannot distinguish the author or root cause of the change in the commit table.

It would be helpful to provide a column where the name of the change or issue originator is visible for the uncommitted entries. A filtering option would be nice also.
fields.summary: Commit changes to JIRA -> Show and allow Filtering of Author

fields.description:
The program feature is not showing as expected in the Portfolio for JIRA menu.

 

Workaround:

-Enable the dark feature as explained in the documentation: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver025/programs-936514514.html]-

Update Portfolio for JIRA to 2.6.1
fields.summary: Program feature is not accessible from the Portfolio menu

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When we're configuring hierarchy levels on Portfolio and adding new levels, there's no scroll bar to display all issue types. This can trigger a few confusion since some issue types won't be displayed at all.

In order to see them accordingly, we'll need a scroll wheel in our mouse (if we're not using a laptop) to be able to scroll down and see all issue types correctly.

h3. Suggest Solution
Add a specific scroll bar when the user clicks on the issue types.
fields.summary: Display scroll bar when you're configuring hierarchy levels

fields.description:
During initial creation of a plan, you can choose which versions (Releases) to import. If a version is not selected, then Portfolio will actively exclude any tickets with that version from the plan. If a ticket is pulled into the plan, but is then added to a version that was not initially imported, the ticket will be removed from the plan.

h5. Example:
* Create a project with versions (v1, v2, etc.)
* Create a new plan
** During the Releases section, do not select v1
* Complete the plan creation
* New tickets will be added to the plan, but if any tickets are now added to have Fix Version of v1, they are automatically excluded

h5. Behaviour Ideas
* During plan creation all tickets in the select filter/board/project should be pulled into the plan. If users want to exclude versions this should be done as part of the JQL within the filters, or by using the "Releases" filter on the plan dashboard.
* Ability to modify the plan source to change the versions that were excluded during initial creation
fields.summary: Ability to Add Tickets from Versions That were not Imported during Initial Plan Create

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Absence is shown incorrectly in the plan when grouping by team or person and some issues do not belong to any of the group. This typically happens with an issue not assigned to a person, not estimated but assigned to a release.
fields.summary: Absence is shown incorrectly in the plan when grouping by team or person and some issues do not belong to any of the group

fields.description:
If an issue is assigned to 2 releases in JIRA, scheduling information are attached to only one of the release. Filtering for the other release will make the issue disappear from the schedule view and remove the scheduled start/end dates.

Steps:
 # Create an issue
 # Create 2 versions
 # Assign the 2 versions to the issue (in JIRA)
 # Calculate -> The issue is on the schedule
 # Filter for the second release -> The issue is no longer on the schedule

The issue is being scheduled as part of the first release and as a result, does not have calculated dates information for the second release.
fields.summary: Filter for a release makes issue disappear from schedule

fields.description:
For plans taking a long time to calculate it would be beneficial to see calculation progress.

Being able to identify issue taking a long time to be scheduled would also be useful.
fields.summary: Add a progress bar for plan calculation

fields.description:
In a large plan with complex teams and overlapping releases it is possible for most of the timeline to have something scheduled in each sprint, but when you filter by a specific team then half of the capacity timeline suddenly "disappears" because most of these tasks belong to separate teams.

 

Selecting "empty releases" restores the missing capacity columns, but it's not immediately clear why this makes sense (or that this option even exists: it is hidden off the gear, while the filter is on the toolbar). Is there a way to keep this option (so that the view can be uncluttered when desired) but make it more intuitive/discoverable so that the team filter doesn't wipe things unexpectedly?
fields.summary: team filter vs "empty releases" checkbox interaction has unintuitive behaviour

fields.description: When filtering for empty/non-empty teams in JQL, issues with that were assigned to a deleted team would still be wrongly included/excluded.
fields.summary: Team is (not) empty wrongly includes issue with deleted team

fields.description:
When using custom schedule ranges or filtering, if the schedule uses target dates, the absences are sometimes expecting a different schedule range which results in them being placed with wrong dates on the schedule view.

Actual scheduling dates work as expected, only visual.
fields.summary: Absences displayed on the wrong dates

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for issues in the Parent Link field on the create and edit issue screens, the search only matches entire words or the entire issue key.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.4.1, Jira 7.11.2
 * JPO 2.4.0, JPO 2.26.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a new level in Portfolio Hierarchy Configuration
 # Add the Parent Link field to the Create or Edit screen
 # Create a new issue of the Issue Type configured for the new level
 # Create or edit an epic and attempt to search for the issue created in step 3 in the Parent Link field

h3. Expected Results

Partial text searches will match the issue. I.E. for an issue of *TEST-1 This is a test parent issue*, Typing "T" should match as would "p" or "par".
h3. Actual Results

Partial text searches will not match the issue, only typing the entire word or issue will will match:

For an issue of *TEST-1 This is a test parent issue*
 * "T" - No matches
 * "p" - No matches
 * "par" - No matches
 * "TEST-1" - Matches
 * "This" - Matches
 * "parent" - Matches

h3. Workaround

Search using full words (tokens)
fields.summary: Text search for Parent Link field only matches on full tokens (words, issue keys)

fields.description: With the removal of the Agile Classic Gadgets, which offered customers the ability to see multiple reports based on custom filters - not necessarily related to a board - it would be nice if Portfolio incorporated the functionality provided by those, especially the burndown chart.
fields.summary: Burndown Chart

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Customers do not see issues that Portfolio assigns to their team by using the Team filter.   

h4. How to replicate
# Create a shared team - Team A
# Add User A to the team
# Create a plan, add Team A as the only team to the plan
# Configure Portfolio to import issue assignee, make sure User A is assigned a ticket (Ticket-A) at the correct level
# At the scope view find ticket-A, and select the team instead of "calculate" option.
# Commit uncommitted changes.
# Delete the shared Team A under managed shared teams
# Create a new shared Team B with User A in it.
# In the plan, configure it to use Team B
# Press calculate for the plan to assign the team to Team B (as calculated team)
# Filter by Team B
# Ticket-A will not show up when it should
# You can run JQL in JIRA - (Key = Ticket-A AND team is not EMPTY)  this will show Ticket-A even though it's team should be empty 
# Ticket-A will now only show if you select the team and then commit the changes.

It seems Team A was never removed from the ticket reference, so filtering for Team B yields no results until it is selected and committed back to JIRA.

h4. Workaround
For each ticket that is affected, select the team and commit the uncommitted changes.

Or through database update -

{code:title=for Postgres 9.4}
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION "json_object_delete_keys"("json" JSON, VARIADIC "keys_to_delete" TEXT [])
  RETURNS JSON
LANGUAGE SQL
IMMUTABLE
STRICT
AS $function$
SELECT COALESCE(
    (SELECT ('{' || string_agg(to_json("key") || ':' || "value", ',') || '}')
     FROM json_each("json")
     WHERE "key" <> ALL ("keys_to_delete")),
    '{}'
) :: JSON
$function$;


UPDATE entity_property ep
SET json_value = json_object_delete_keys(json_value::json, 'team_id')
WHERE
  ((json_value :: JSON) ->> 'team_id') IS NOT NULL
  AND json_value :: JSON ->> 'team_id' NOT IN (
    SELECT "ID" :: TEXT
    FROM "AO_82B313_TEAM"
  )
{code}

The above will remove the reference of the teams that no longer exists from the each issue.
fields.summary: In Scope View - Team filter does not show issues

fields.description:
Before using Portfolio, we created a "hierarchy" for our issues across multiple projects using Issue Links.  We mistakenly assumed that Porfolio would understand these links based on the hierarchy we set up in the Portfolio settings, but it does not.  Portfolio uses its own linking mechanism (via the Parent Link field, for example) and doesn't respect any of the existing issue links.  As a user I do *not* want to re-link several hundred issues in Portfolio by hand.  

Please make Portfolio understand JIRA Issue Links, with respect to the hierarchy defined in the Portfolio admin settings.
fields.summary: Portfolio should understand existing Issue Links

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when you export out the scope report to csv format, the hierarchy will only be visible due to the ranking of the rows.
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better if we could provide options when export to different kinda format, example:
h6. Option A (The current one):
{code}
Initiative INI-1
Feature FEA-1
Epic TMP-1
Story TMP-2
{code}

h6. Option B (The additional option):
{code}
Initiative INI-1, NULL, NULL, NULL
Feature FEA-1, INI-1, NULL, NULL
Epic TMP-1, INI-1, FEA-1, NULL
Story TMP-2, TMP-1, INI-1, FEA-1
{code}
fields.summary: scope report export option

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently if you have a large or huge amount of team and members in a single Portfolio plan, the performance of calculation and scheduling will suffer drastically.
h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the efficiency of of calculation and scheduling when dealing with large amount of team and members
h3. Workaround 
Reduce the amount of team and members
fields.summary: improve performance when plan having large amount of team and members

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Portfolio for JIRA allows any user to commit other users uncommitted changes. This can be a problem when multiple users concurrently making the changes but one of them are not ready to commit the change.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Group the uncommitted changes based on user and default it to the current user changes. Have an option to commit the changes for other users.
* Set default Edit permission to only edit own changes while Administrator can edit all users changes.

h3. Why this is important
This helps multiple users plan using Portfolio correctly and avoid committing what is unnecessary.
fields.summary: A user should not allow to commit other users changes

fields.description:
At the moment portfolio doesn't support "version picker" custom fields.  

We use currently use "Fix Version/s" for complete tasks and a custom field called "Target Version" for planning purposes.  Unfortunately setting the "Releases" field updates the wrong field.  

Two options
 # Add support for "Version Picker" custom fields
 # Allow "Releases" to update custom fields
fields.summary: Add support for version picker custom fields

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, JPO admin needs to manually add users as team members. It does not allow the admin to add group or role. 

h5. Suggested Solution
In some user's scenario, the team looks into group or role instead of individual users. Since member field in JIRA Portfolio plan allows multiple members to be assigned, it makes sense to allow assigning role or group. It would be great to have either of the following:
# Allow adding group/role as team member, OR
# Portfolio automatically grab project roles/group (based on plan sources) and add them as team members
fields.summary: Allow adding group/role as team members

fields.description:
We have a lot of teams working with JIRA, so we have to manage a long shared team list.

The manage shared team list will be shown incompletely if more than 90 teams are configured (no pages, nothing). Workaround: Use the search field to filter the teams. But to get an overview this is not applicable.

The same problem will be find in the team field in JIRA 7.2.9.

 We are using JIRA portfolio server v2.2.4., same problem in v. 2.6
fields.summary: Number of teams in "Manage shared teams" view should not be restricted.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Current, we can define maximum assignees per story in a plan; {{Configure plan > Scheduling > Maximum assignees per story}}.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the same configuration for all the hierarchy level.
fields.summary: Define maximum assignees for Initiatives and other levels

fields.description:
The issue ID appearing in the scope view makes it difficult to read through a plan, especially if tasks are given an identifier in other ways. This makes Portfolio difficult to use for non-software projects that have external task ID codes.

 

!image-2017-08-10-14-05-17-509.png!
fields.summary: Ability to hide issue ID from scope view.

fields.description: Given that the issue sources aren't SCRUM related, it would be interesting to allow a team to be associated with multiple issue sources / Projects.
fields.summary: Allow to assign multiple sources to a team

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have timescale on top of issue timeline that can show Year, Quarter, Month (or even a week) for the current timeline. I find myself adding dummy calendar items to show my customers when their work with 'land' in production. See example below

!Screen Shot 2017-08-01 at 9.42.58 AM.png!
fields.summary: Static Timescale for Timeline

fields.description:
Currently, when you click on an item in the schedule to view its dependencies, it will gray out the issues that aren't involved and highlight those that are. If you have a lot of items in your schedule view (or grouped by sprints), you often can't see the related item without scrolling. There's a lot of wasted space on the screen displaying issues that aren't related.

Customer is requesting that there be a way to either filter the view to show ONLY the dependencies or somehow improve the dependencies view to limit items that aren't related. Perhaps collapse teams and their sprints that aren't involved, etc. Something so limit the crowded view when looking for dependencies.
fields.summary: Improve dependencies view

fields.description:
Our executives like to shuffle priorities around and then ask the question what was impacted?

It would be great to have a quick view that shows what scheduled end dates have changed as a result of shifts in priorities. 

Additionally, it would be great to be able to see the delta, on how much a project shifted in either direction.
fields.summary: Highlight Schedule Change due to shift in priorities

fields.description: When I try to allocate people for planning purposes in JIRA Portfolio the names show up in the order they were entered. That makes finding the right person difficult. It would be better to see them in alphabetical order and to be able to start typing a name and auto fill.
fields.summary: Enable saving an alphabetical sorting of team members

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Portfolio does not have the ability to add custom fields of type version picker from JRA Software into your plan. Currently, the only types possible are specified in [Configuring plan settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/configuring-plan-settings-828785211.html#Configuringplansettings-Customfields]

h3. Suggested Solution
Add custom field of type version picker into the plan. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently, there is no workaround for this.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio Admin, I would like to add

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user without the 'Schedule Issue' permission attempts to commit issues, the commit fails and duplicates the issue by creating a new issue in JIRA while keeping the scenario issue. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user without the 'Schedule Issue' permission
# Login as user
# Add an issue to a Portfolio plan
# Commit Changes

h3. Expected Results

User is presented with a permission error noting they do not have permission to create the issue in the project

h3. Actual Results

* An error 'Changes couldn't be committed to JIRA. Your attention may be required.' is thrown in the UI
* The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2017-07-14 16:03:31,071 http-nio-8080-exec-165 url:/rest/jpo/1.0/issues/comm...sername:xxx  ERROR l 963x6295008x9   /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.r.j.env.rank.BaseJiraEnvironmentRankService]
com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.rank.BatchAgileRankException
	at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.rank.AgileRankOperationResponse.create(AgileRankOperationResponse.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.InternalAgileRankService.rankAfter(InternalAgileRankService.java:143)
	at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.BaseAgileRankServiceBridgeJpo.rankAfter(BaseAgileRankServiceBridgeJpo.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.AgileDefaultRankDomainRankServiceBridgeJpo.rankAfter(AgileDefaultRankDomainRankServiceBridgeJpo.java:12)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.env.rank.BaseJiraEnvironmentRankService.rankAfter(BaseJiraEnvironmentRankService.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.rank.BaseKeyRankService.rankAfter(BaseKeyRankService.java:200)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.rank.DefaultIssueDomainKeyRankService.rankAfter(DefaultIssueDomainKeyRankService.java:10)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.scenario.common.BaseRankableScenarioEntityCommitService$2.perform(BaseRankableScenarioEntityCommitService.java:195)
{noformat}
 * Issues are duplicated by creating a new issue in JIRA while keeping the scenario issue. 

h3.Workaround

Changes can be committed by a user with schedule issue permission or grant schedule issue permission to the user.
fields.summary: Commit fails when committing issues with a user missing the `Schedule Issue` permission

fields.description:
Currently JPO allows 5000 issues to load and only 2000 issues to render.

In our use case we would like to render more than 2000. Can the limit be increased to let's say 3000 or 4000?
fields.summary: Increase issue render limit

fields.description:
Currently, information is only shown on the timeline when both target start and target end dates are available.

It would be most useful to also show a "milestone"-like indicator when only target end date was entered.
fields.summary: Show Target End on the timeline when Target Start is empty
Issue property is not being deleted when moving an Issue to most top Hierarchy level

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding user accounts to a team in Portfolio, JIRA should not list all of the user accounts that exist in the {{cwd_user}} table of the database. But currently it does.


h3. Suggested Solution
Portfolio should provide a means to filter out user accounts in JIRA that only have the JIRA Service Desk customer role.


h3. Why this is important
Since JIRA Service Desk will allow an unlimited number of customer accounts, it can make the team management more difficult to even see potentially thousands of users when trying to add members to a team.  It would help to be able to just remove all those accounts that would never be wanted for this purpose.

Also since service desk customers do not have access to the main JIRA site, and are very unlikely to ever be listed as the assignee of an issue, it doesn't really make sense as to why you would want to place a JSD customer on a team for portfolio management purposes.
fields.summary: Portfolio should be able to limit the user accounts shown as availble to be added to teams

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When two parallel sprints are not in correct order (the second sprint has earlier start date than the first sprint), then the second sprint will not be shown in Portfolio plan

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Start Sample Sprint 2 (start date : July 2017) (1st sprint)
# Start Sample Sprint 3 (start date : June 2017) (2nd sprint)
!board1.png|thumbnail!
# Load the Portfolio plan

h4. Expected Result
Portfolio plan should show sprint *Sample Sprint 2* and *Sample Sprint 3*

h4. Actual Result
Portfolio does not show sprint *Sample Sprint 3*
!jpo1.png|thumbnail!
This affects the issues associated with Sample Sprint 3 that are shown under other sprints in Portfolio plan

h4. Workaround
Make sure that the sprints are in correct order
!board2.png|thumbnail!
Recalculate the plan, and the sprint will be shown
!jpo2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sprint is not shown in Portfolio plan when parallel sprints are not in correct order

fields.description: Ability to change icons for Portfolio teams
fields.summary: Ability to change icons for Portfolio teams

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an administrator I would like the ability to Disable the creation of Classic Plans and only have the option to use Live Plans.

h3. Suggested Solution
Feature flag option to remove the following item from Create Plan dialogue:
{quote}
Are you a Portfolio old-timer and want a classic plan? Create a classic plan or import a plan
{quote}
 
h3. Workaround
No Workaround at this time
fields.summary: Ability to disable Classic Plan Creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Portfolio SERVER Classic Plan Migration guide notes the depreciation of classic plans In the cloud platform as a reason for needing to migrate to live plans:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/migration-guide-859479290.html
{quote}
h2.Why should I migrate to live plans? 
Portfolio for JIRA will discontinue supporting Classic plans by April 1st, 2017 for Cloud instances.
{quote}

As of current release Portfolio 2.3.0 JIRA Server 6.3 - 7.4.1 Released 2017-07-11 the option to create classic plans is still an option via the Create Plan step 1 footer option:
{quote}
Are you a Portfolio old-timer and want a classic plan? Create a classic plan or import a plan
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Need to provide server platform specific reason for the Reasons to migrate section

h3. Why this is important
Depreciation of a feature and support in the Cloud platform is not relevant to the Server platform unless the feature is also being deprecated in Server, in which case the Server Specific details need to be included not the cloud platform details.
fields.summary: JIRA Portfolio Classic Plan documentation needs clarification

fields.description:
When the user lacks permission and tries to commit a version change (so a change to an issue Fix Version) the error message is too generic when it should give information has for why the commit is not possible.

For example:

If the user does not have Issue edit permissions, the error message will be a generic failure while it should say that the user does not have Edit Permission.

 

This happens because Portfolio checks for the `Resolve Issue` permission on its own as the JIRA API does not. When the JIRA validation fails (no edit permission for example) the Portfolio validation fails to check for the `Resolve Issue` permission and does not forward prior validation error messages correctly.

Portfolio side validation should not happen if the JIRA validation failed.
fields.summary: Error message on commit is not explicit enough when setting fix version and lacking multiple permissions

fields.description:
h4. Summary

A user is able to delete a filter used in a JIRA Portfolio plan. The user is not warned that the filter is used in a plan.

When the filter is deleted the issue source is removed from the plan. Issues associated with that source will also be removed from the plan, provided they are not associated with another issue source.
h4. Suggested Change

Warn user when deleting filter associated with JIRA Portfolio plan.
h4. Notes

A warning is presented when deleting a filter associated with a JIRA Software board. A similar warning is desired for JIRA Portfolio.
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6706
fields.summary: No warning when deleting filter used in as issue source in plan

fields.description:
Currently you cannot have multiple releases of the same project in the same Cross Project Release.

Customers would like to be able to add multiple releases per project into a Cross Project Release.
fields.summary: I would like to add multiple releases (Project specific) per project into a Cross Project Release

fields.description:
In order to share a plan with someone, or discuss an impact of a change, I am required to send them not just a link to the plan, but a list of instructions often more than ten items long of the changes they have to make to the display to see what I am seeing.
 # Go to (url)
 # Click on "Initiative" and change it to Story
 # Remove the release column
 # Add column for ...
 # etc etc etc

We need a shareable link that shows the view we have. Better yet, we need the ability to save views for a Plan, and select a default view. Customizing views is great, but I have dozens of Plans and not a single one of them is best viewed the same way.
fields.summary: Plans are not shareable without saved views

fields.description:
In order to pull together a plan which involves a handful epics and initiatives and display them requires some fairly obtuse JQL, far beyond most PMO capabilities. Furthermore, none of the filters we've created so far are sustainable, they all require entry of epic or initiave IDs.

Even just "show me everything in these epics" requires manually tracking the list of epics inside the filter.

{{"Epic Link" in (EPIC-X,EPIC-Y,EPIC-Z) OR id}}{{ in (EPIC-X,EPIC-Y,EPIC-Z) OR "Parent link" in (INIT-X,INIT-Y,INIT-Z)}}

Many of the filters for specific PMOs are so complex that we're having to build 4-5 filters and then a meta-filter that uses them all :(

I believe that automatically grabbing the epics and intiatives etc from the hierarchy of included stories should be done by Portfolio and not forced down to the query editor. This would also allow reuse of filters from existing Kanban and Scrum boards.
fields.summary: Automatic or simpler include of Epics and Initiatives

fields.description:
We would like to use Portfolio as to report RAG Status of items. But currently, the color custom field is not supported by Portfolio. It would be great if this can be supported.

Or, if at least HTML is supported we could use a normal text custom field so that it can appear as formatted text instead of as shown below:

 

!image-2017-07-14-18-28-37-973.png!
fields.summary: Add Color custom field support on Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding the JIRA Portfolio "TEAM" custom field to a screen, if a value is present a issue history event is triggered on every update without making a change to the value.  This is extremely evident when added to EDIT issue Screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project linked to a plan
# Create a "shared team" in the plan
# Add the "TEAM" field a screen (i.e. EDIT screen)
# Trigger the screen and update other fields without adding value to the TEAM field
## Note only updated fields are listed in issue history, Team field shows no update
# trigger the same screen again and add the shared team to the TEAM field
## NOTE Team field correctly listed in issue history as a modified item
# Trigger other field updates via the same screen without modifying the team value

h3. Expected Results
Only updated fields are listed as modified in change history

h3. Actual Results
Modified fields are shown correctly and on some updates the TEAM field is listed as changed but is not listed for others.

 
h3. Notes
see screenshot below: 
!Screen Shot 2017-07-11 at 4.10.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Adding TEAM to the EDIT Screen The following items DO show the update to the  to the Team field of "TS board team" to "TS board team"
* Description 
* Summary
* Assignee
* Clicking update without making any changes to other fields
* Priority
* Comment

BUT The following DO NOT show an update to the TEAM Field applying the same action:
* Link Issue
* Epic Link

h3.Workaround
* Do not add the team field to the edit Screen, and only add it in a single transition that you would like to use to set the team field.
OR
* Do not add team to a screen and modify values in portfolio Scope View OR under the People Section of the Main issue view.
fields.summary: Adding Team Field to screen triggers history event for every update

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When exporting issues from issue navigator to CSV, the exported file shows package class for Parent Link field instead of the field value

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Associate issue with team in Portfolio live plan
# Go to issue navigator to retrieve issues with Parent Link
# Export as CSV (include Team field)

h4. Expected Result
CSV file will show team name or team ID under Parent Link column

h4. Actual Result
CSV file shows package class {{com.atlassian.rm.jpo.env.issues.JiraIssueService$3@6aa972ee}} instead
fields.summary: Export issue (from issue navigator) does not retrieve correct value for Export issue (from issue navigator) does not retrieve correct value for Parent Link field

fields.description: Add quick filter like project, release etc. This option is useful for better resource planing .
fields.summary: Filter on Assignee

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Creating a Plan, boards with the special character '+' or '&' in the Title cannot be located when searching

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Board with a "+" in the title, i.e.: "S+F Test"
# Create plan and search for the board by typing out the board name at "Step 2: Connect to your teams' work" i.e. "S+"

h3. Expected Results
Board is found with search

h3. Actual Results
The Board is not found
!Screen Shot 2017-07-10 at 12.01.47 PM.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
This will impact workload the most if there are many boards using a special character in a naming convention

h3.Workaround
* Use text after the "+" character can locate the board title
!Screen Shot 2017-07-10 at 12.02.00 PM.png|thumbnail!
* Use _ or space in board titles instead, and avoid special characters
fields.summary: Special Character '+' in Board Title cannot be located in search

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no configuration to display more information for the releases report in Portfolio, it would be great if we can display issue status, labels, theme colors and etc in the card itself.

h3. Suggested Solution
Propose to have a configuration to customize/display more information in the card view of the releases report in Portfolio.
fields.summary: customise releases report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the plan has high amount of issues in it such as 3000+ issues and above, the rendering for HTML and hierarchy calculation will took up the most time which eventually delay the plan to load up.

Example result of the rendering which is causing the slowness to load up the plan after running the dev mode:
* {{com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-common-shared-scripts.js?locale=en-US:355 table.render-content: 1.91e+4ms}}
* {{com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-common-shared-scripts.js?locale=en-US:355 issues.loading.process.calculateHierarchy: 1.70e+4ms}}

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a more efficient, light and simpler algorithm to render the HTML and perform the hierarchy calculation.

h3. Additional Info
* The performance of the plan calculation will be drastically affected by the amount of Team members is having in the plan itself.
fields.summary: improve performance on rendering for HTML and hierarchy calculation

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When exporting issues from issue navigator to CSV or using REST API, the data shows package class for Parent Field instead of the value

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Associate Child Issues and Parent Links in JIRA/Portfolio
# Go to issue navigator to retrieve the issues with a Parent Link
# Export as CSV (include Team field)
# Use REST API to get issue data 
e.g.:
{code}
curl -D- -u admin:password -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:61481/jira722/rest/api/2/issue/IssueID
{code}

h4. Expected Result
The CSV and REST API results show the actual value of the Parent Link field

h4. Actual Result
CSV file and REST results will show the package class {{"customfield_10201":"com.atlassian.rm.jpo.env.issues.JiraIssueService$3@d1c7c46"}}

h4.Additional Notes: 
This was fixed for Team Field but not Parent Link: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1794
fields.summary: Export issue (from issue navigator) and REST API does not retrieve correct value for Parent Link

fields.description:
Current date: showing a vertical line when the current date is visible allows for a quick orientation on the plan. This seems to be a best practice in many Gantt chart tools.

Cursor position: showing a vertical line wherever the mouse cursor is allows for a quick correlation of issues.
fields.summary: In Gantt charts, show a fixed vertical line for the current date, and a moving vertical line for the cursor position

fields.description: As a Portfolio Admin, I can't tell who owns a portfolio plan nor when it was created, so it becomes impossible to purge unnecessary plans.
fields.summary: Better information on Portfolio Plan creation/ownership

fields.description:
We have such a case:

There are several stages in plan.
One team member can have several stages. 
If one member have two or more stages, we need that this member was scheduled to all stages of one issue, which he/she is able to execute.

For example, stages: 
1)Functional Requirements
2)Development
3)Functional Testing
4)Update documentation

We need that stage 1(Functional Requirements) and stage 4 (Update documentation) were scheduled to the same person.
fields.summary: Minimize amount of assignees.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Portfolio Scheduler takes multiple factors into consideration for issues in the plan. This is detailed in [Scheduling behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/scheduling-behavior-802170552.html]. However, there may be plans, where users want this plan to strictly follow the issues priority. 

One scenario would be that issues with lower priority would be worked on before issues with higher priority due to it having a low estimation. This could cause undesired outcomes when multiple issues of lower priority are created and so the higher priority issue is always delayed. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a schedule option for the plan, that will allow for the strict following of issue priority and to ignore the estimation of the issue. 
 
h3. Workaround
Use dependencies to make sure this issue is worked on first.
fields.summary: Scheduling options to strictly follow issue priority

fields.description:
JIRa Portfolio brokes functionality of existing "Fix Version" field.

In JIRA Software "Fix version" is a list of Versions.  They might be not only releases, but e.g build numbers , etc

In JIRa Portfolio you limited it only to one value.

Why ? Why it can't be a list with append possibility ?
fields.summary: Broken "Fix Version" field in JIRA Portfolio - Portfolio operations on Releases overrides "fix version" designed to be a list , not a single value field.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is inconsistency for rendering the team value for Subtask in the Scope view. 
* The Team value is shown as the same to its parent when it is manually set. 
* The Team value is *not* shown, leave empty when the parent issue is set to calculate

h3. Suggested Solution
Ensure the consistency, show the Team value for all subtask to be equal to Parent issue regardless if it is manually set or automatically calculated.

h3. Why this is important
Inconsistency can cause misunderstanding on the state of the subtask issue, who should be working on them. Indeed Portfolio considers Subtask to be part of Parent hence the same team should by default work on them.
fields.summary: Inconsistency on Team value rendered for Subtasks

fields.description:
Hi,

As i (in portfolio) export the "Report: Schedule" as Roadmap (and give it to Customers) i really would like to display the "scheduled dates" for the Sprints (In hierarchy view mode story).

Or make in the green time line below a dot after each month.

Becuse if it is exported (Printed to PDF) they can't hover the green line. Thus they only see the start and end date without any granularity in between.

 

I've added a Screen where i did draw where and what i mean.

 

i thinks this is a very small visibility feature, but would just take me some effort. As currently im going to put the "start" and end dates in the sprint names if i produce a Roadmap for export and give to customers.

 

kind regards,

marcel
fields.summary: In portfolio allow to display Scheduled Time in Scope and/or Report: Schedule

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when searching or filtering a particular Epic on Epic view. The scope does not include it related Stories and Subtasks.

As an example, when filtering for Epic issue SSP-25:
!filterview.png|thumbnail!

Without any filter, we can see the stories and subtasks related to Epic SSP-25:
!normalview.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the stories and subtasks in Scope view when filtering Epic SSP-25. So that it'll be something like the following expectation:
!expectview.png|thumbnail!

h3. Why this is important
This will help user experience in filtering a particular issue _and_ avoid giving a false understanding whether the issue filtered has any stories or subtasks related to it.
fields.summary: Show Stories in Scope when filtering Epic
Possibility to add all JIRa custom fields as columns in Scope detailed view

fields.description:
As a JIRa Administrator I would like to split JIRA Portfolio permission between:

"Ability to created shared Teams" and "Ability to manage shared Teams Members"

 

right now they are combined together as:

!image-2017-05-26-09-05-29-523.png!
fields.summary: Split "Shared Team Management" permission

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a plan with 1 story and subtask
 # Give the subtask target start and end dates
 # Add 2 skills to the plan
 # Add a member to the team
 # Calculate. Then group the schedule by projects
 # An error is shown.

Stack trace:
{code:java}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'attributes' of undefined
    at Function.SimpleHierarchyController.create (controller.js:44)
    at createHierarchyController (data-container.js:131)
    at Object.retrieveSubHierarchyController (data-container.js:246)
    at projectLaneCanBeShown (stream-base.js:15)
    at Function.StreamBaseWorkItemHipsterScrollingProvider.create (stream-base.js:44)
    at SprintsViewController.WorkItemViewController.createProviders (view-controller.js:59)
    at SprintsViewController.BaseLaneViewController.initialize (view-controller.js:20)
    at SprintsViewController.o.Controller (libs-script-optimized.js?locale=-1:251)
    at SprintsViewController.GeppettoController [as constructor] (controller.js:17)
    at SprintsViewController.GeppettoViewController [as constructor] (view-controller.js:14){code}
!image-2017-05-26-10-26-35-002.png!
fields.summary: Exception when grouping by projects in certain situations

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Confluence page
2.  Add the JIRA issue macro and query for issues in a JIRA project that uses JPO
3. Select the field Parent Issue to display

Expected
The parent issue key should be shown. Maybe even as a link to the issue

Actual
A Java object ref is shown

Request: please update the JPO object to allow Confluence to render it properly
fields.summary: Better display of the Parent Issue field in jiraissue macro in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when the issue is having a long and length summary, JIRA Portfolio will display it as {{...}}
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can implement something like a hint displaying the full summary when hovering issues with long summary so that it can give a better overview for the user when filtering out issues from the plan backlog.
fields.summary: show hint with full summary when hovering issues with long summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Restoring JIRA Cloud to Server generating an java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00972: identifier is too long


h3. Environment
* Migrating JIRA Cloud to Server
* JIRA Cloud instance was using Portfolio
* JIRA Server is connected to an Oracle database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a Cloud backup of a JIRA instance with Portfolio
# Restore this XML backup to a current JIRA Server 7.3.6

h3. Expected Results
Backup restores as expected


h3. Actual Results
Restoration reached 90% before generating this ORA-00972 error:

{code:borderStyle=solid}
2017-05-22 23:27:11,455 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO sysadmin 1318x155x1 1f5k3vc 10.21.38.230 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Importing data is 89% complete...
2017-05-22 23:28:03,817 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO sysadmin 1318x155x1 1f5k3vc 10.21.38.230 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Importing data is 90% complete...
2017-05-22 23:28:39,074 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO sysadmin 1318x155x1 1f5k3vc 10.21.38.230 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Finished storing Generic Values.
2017-05-22 23:28:39,169 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 DEBUG sysadmin 1318x155x1 1f5k3vc 10.21.38.230 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] startCleaning
2017-05-22 23:28:39,240 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 DEBUG sysadmin 1318x155x1 1f5k3vc 10.21.38.230 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] stopCleaning

com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with <unknown plugin> (table AO_D9132D_SCENARIO_TEAM_EXCLUDED_SPRINTS):Error executing update for SQL statement 'ALTER TABLE "AO_D9132D_SCENARIO_TEAM_EXCLUDED_SPRINTS" DISABLE ALL TRIGGERS'

	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:583)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:757)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00972: identifier is too long
{code}


 
h3. Notes
* It appears that this error is cause by Portfolio creating a table name that is too long to be valid in an Oracle database. 
* This is a similar error to the JSD bug [JSDSERVER-4438|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4438]
* Oracle documentation on table name / object name limitations: [Schema Object Names and Qualifiers|http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28286/sql_elements008.htm#sthref727]

h3.Workaround
* Create a Postgres database for JIRA server to use and import the Cloud backup to that instance instead.
fields.summary: Restoring JIRA Cloud to Server generating an java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00972: identifier is too long

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have multiple absence in a specific team member, if there is any existing exception, it will be duplicated somehow.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Server 7.3.x
* JIRA Portfolio Server 2.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a team member under a Team
# Set an absence and exception into this team member
# Add another absence to this specific team member

h3. Expected Results
There will be only one exception into under this team member

h3. Actual Results
There is a duplicate amount of exception under this team member which means there are 2 same exception right now
fields.summary: duplicate exceptions for Team member when there is multiple absence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If we have an issue with summary {{ABC-HHH-192 Test}}, then you can only search if {{ABC-HHH-192}} or {{Test}} is specified. This is because the way JIRA searches is, it matches full words only, and `-` character is not a word separator.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for parts of the text to be searchable
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to search for issues in the filter based on certain part of the word

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Plan Timezone's have been released to Portfolio for JIRA Cloud, this is to track Implementation Plan Timezone For JIRA Server

Details on Plan Timezone can be seen in Cloud Documentation Space here:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/configuring-working-hours-and-days-828785191.html
fields.summary: Plan Timezone for JIRA Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, a CPR should be deleted once it is no longer required

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the option to simply exclude from the plan as regular releases.

h3. Why this is important
It is not possible to keep track of old CPR without leaving them in the plan.
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently, there is no workaround for this.
fields.summary: As an user, I would like to be able to exclude a cross project release upon completion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you have a huge list of team member with skill and stages to define under the Team section, there are not header/column showing which is which

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the respective header/column
fields.summary: Team skill header/column should be display when dealing with a long list of team members
Provide reporting on teams' performance to complete committed work

fields.description: As a product owner, I would like to see story points on the visual bar representing an item in schedule view so that I can know at a glance the estimates associated with the work and can quickly troubleshoot overbooked sprints and see which issues are responsible for the overage.
fields.summary: Surface the estimate size of items in the schedule

fields.description:
* Increase the size, ease of use for the bottom scroll bar. It's hard to grab and often illusive
 * Allow to scroll via 2-finger swipe
fields.summary: Improve usability of horizontal scrolling in the scope table

fields.description:
Currently, the Original Estimates field does not apply on the issue if you're using points. If the plan is set to use Points instead of hours and you put something in Original Story Points and commit it. It doesn't exist anywhere except on the Plan. You can't expose it on an issue, you can't query on it, it's not in the issue history anywhere. It only works to show estimates vs actuals if you're using hours.

As a product owner, I need to be able to set a SWAG (tentative estimate) on a story before officially committing to points so that I can make a rough pass in planning without impacting metrics.
fields.summary: Surface the Original Story Point field on JIRA issues

fields.description:
Similar to the behaviour of releases/teams/parent etc. columns where the value of all the children is set along with the parent, perform the same behaviour for labels and components.

As a scrum master, I often need to apply a label or component to all items related to a particular parent so that I have full traceability.
fields.summary: When setting labels/component value on a parent issue bulk set its children too

fields.description:
Ideally - a toggle for each type of calculation to enable/disable variables to be included/excluded from the calculation

As a plan owner, I would like to be able to toggle on/off certain calculations so that I have better control over my plan when I want to. For example, while sometimes it may be useful for the tool to predict my sprints, the use case is often that the sprint has been determined and should be input by the scrum master or product owner. Having it calculate something and fill in the field can be confusing for users and lead to items not truly being scheduled because the plan owner didn't explicitly choose a sprint for the item and thus the sprint was only reflected in the Plan, not on the agile boards.
fields.summary: Allow for finer control of schedule calculation

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to have a full issue view "pop out" so that the need for me to open a new tab to go to full issue view is limited.

Currently, you get a very limited view of the full details of the issue and have to open the issue in a separate tab to get all the details. Having a pop out view would keep users from context switching.
fields.summary: Allow to open full issue details from Portfolio plans without switching context

fields.description:
Portfolio does not support changing the issue type for an issue, for both uncommitted issues or existing issues. If you mistakenly select the wrong issue type at creation in Portfolio you must manually copy all information from that issue to one with the correct type, or commit it and manually change the type in JIRA.

For committed issues, this should follow the same rules as for the Issue Type field in JIRA - editing between issue types that are assigned to the same workflow should be allowed.

For uncommitted issues it should be fully editable.
fields.summary: Ability to change issue type in Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently,  for a cross project release, there is no easy way to move all the remaining issues at the end of the release to another release. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for better handling, where Portfolio will ask where to move the remaining issues.
fields.summary: Better handling for Cross Project Releases
